info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 03 at 5:32AM CDT until July 03 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON, UNION, NORTHEASTERN BOLLINGER, NORTHERN CAPE GIRARDEAU AND SOUTHERN PERRY COUNTIES... At 532 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen, with 4 to 5 inches of rainfall estimated across western and central Union County. While the heaviest rains have ended, it will take time for any ongoing flooding to recede. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cape Girardeau, Jackson, Perryville, Anna, Jonesboro, Trail Of Tears State Park, Bollinger Mill State Historic Site, Cobden, Dongola, Grand Tower, Altenburg, Ware, Daisy, Millersville, Burfordville, Alliance, Makanda, Alto Pass, Frohna and Oak Ridge. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
